data.enText: a permanent physical or mental condition that makes it difficult or impossible to use a particular part of your body or mind

data.chText: 简尽管有生理缺陷，却能够保住一份全职工作。
data.enText: Despite her handicap, Jane is able to hold down a full-time job.

data.chText: 智力 / 生理 / 视力缺陷

data.enText: something that makes it difficult for sb to do sth

data.chText: 事实证明不会讲这种语言造成的障碍比我所想象的大。
data.enText: Not speaking the language proved to be a bigger handicap than I'd imagined.

data.chText: 让步赛（使参赛者中的优势方跑得较远、增加负重等）；（让步赛中给优势方施加的）障碍，不利条件
data.enText: a race or competition in which the most skilful must run further, carry extra weight, etc. in order to give all those taking part an equal chance of winning; the disadvantage that is given to sb you are competing against in such a race or competition

data.chText: 给弱者增加的杆数（按击球次数计数，并随参赛者的进步而减少）
data.enText: an advantage given to a weaker player so that competition is more equal when they play against a stronger player. It is expressed as a number related to the number of times a player hits the ball and gets lower as he/she improves.
to make sth more difficult for sb to do

data.chText: 英镑坚挺影响了英国的出口。
data.enText: British exports have been handicapped by the strong pound.

means: 让步赛(使参赛者中的优势方跑得较远、增加负重等)
(让步赛中给优势方施加的)障碍，不利条件

ex.chText: 他的无知使他处于不利地位。
ex.enText: His ignorance placed him at a disadvantage.
The two plans have their advantages and disadvantages.

synonyms.bx: 指引起问题、妨碍某人或某事成功或发挥作用的因素。

ex.chText: 这座城市唯一的不足就是交通。
ex.enText: The only drawback of this city is its traffic.

ex.chText: 这个手机的主要毛病在于它的电池不耐用。
ex.enText: The main drawback of this cellphone is that its battery easily loses its charge.

synonyms.bx: 指计划、产品等的不足之处。

ex.chText: 没受过教育的确是一个障碍。
ex.enText: Lack of education is a real handicap.

ex.chText: 如果他打算入伍，那么视力不好可以算是一个大大的不利条件。
ex.enText: Poor eyesight can be a serious handicap if he wants to join the army.

synonyms.bx: 指妨碍某人达成目标的因素。

tr: advantage given to a competitor to equalize chances of winning
something immaterial that interferes with or delays action or progress
the condition of being unable to perform as a consequence of physical or mental unfitness

example: He was disabled in a car accident
The brace I have to wear is hindering my movements

tr: attempt to forecast the winner (especially in a horse race) and assign odds for or against a contestant

value.def: A handicap is a physical or mental disability.

example.ex: He lost his leg when he was ten, but learnt to overcome his handicap.
example.tran: 他10岁时失去了一条腿，但他学会了克服自己的残疾。

value.def: A handicap is an event or situation that places you at a disadvantage and makes it harder for you to do something.

example.ex: She was away from school for 15 weeks, a handicap she could have done without...
example.tran: 她有15周没上学，这给她带来了本不该有的障碍。

example.ex: Being a foreigner was not a handicap.
example.tran: 身为外国人并不是一个障碍。

value.def: If an event or a situation handicaps someone or something, it places them at a disadvantage.

example.ex: Greater levels of stress may seriously handicap some students...
example.tran: 压力的加重可能会给一些学生带来严重的负面影响。

example.ex: The industrial injuries scheme takes into account the actual disability and whether it handicaps a person in working.
example.tran: 工伤赔偿方案要考虑实际残疾情况以及残疾是否会影响其工作能力。

value.def: In golf, a handicap is an advantage given to someone who is not a good player, in order to make the players more equal. As you improve, your handicap gets lower.

example.ex: I see your handicap is down from 16 to 12.
example.tran: 我发现你的差点已从16杆降到了12杆。

value.tran: （高尔夫运动中的）给弱者增加的杆数，差点

value.def: In horse racing, a handicap is a race in which some competitors are given a disadvantage of extra weight in an attempt to give everyone an equal chance of winning.
